Akhenaten: Akhenaten was a pharaoh of Egypt known for religious reforms and establishing the city of Amarna.
Bent-pyramid-for-senefru: A unique pyramid built by Pharaoh Sneferu, known for its bent angle near Dahshur.
Colossal-Statue-of-Ramesses-II: A massive statue of Ramses II that once stood in the temple at Memphis.
Colossoi-of-Memnon: Two massive stone statues of Pharaoh Amenhotep III located in Luxor.
Goddess-Isis-with-her-child: Statue depicting the goddess Isis breastfeeding her child Horus, symbol of motherhood.
Hatshepsut: One of the few female pharaohs of Egypt, known for her prosperous reign and massive temple.
Hatshepsut-face: A close-up sculpture of Queen Hatshepsuts face, reflecting royal features and style.
Khafre-Pyramid: The second largest pyramid at Giza, built for Pharaoh Khafre.
Mask-of-Tutankhamun: The golden burial mask of the boy king Tutankhamun, discovered in his tomb in the Valley of the Kings.
Nefertiti: A famous bust of Queen Nefertiti, known for her beauty and role in the Amarna Period.
Pyramid_of_Djoser: The first pyramid built in Egypt, a step pyramid constructed during the reign of Djoser.
Ramessum: The mortuary temple of Ramesses II, located in Thebes (Luxor).
Ramses-II-Red-Granite-Statue: A red granite statue of Ramses II showcasing his power and divine kingship.
Statue-of-King-Zoser: A statue of Pharaoh Djoser, who commissioned the first step pyramid.
Statue-of-Tutankhamun-with-Ankhesenamun: A statue showing King Tutankhamun with his wife Ankhesenamun.
Temple_of_Isis_in_Philae: A temple dedicated to the goddess Isis, located on Philae Island in Aswan.
Temple_of_Kom_Ombo: A double temple in Kom Ombo dedicated to both Sobek and Horus.
The Great Temple of Ramesses -: Abu Simbel, a rock-cut temple built by Ramesses II featuring four colossal statues.
amenhotep-iii-and-tiye: A statue showing Pharaoh Amenhotep III with his wife Queen Tiye.
bust-of-ramesses-ii: A bust of Pharaoh Ramesses II, one of Egyptâ€™s greatest rulers.
menkaure-pyramid: The smallest of the three pyramids at Giza, built for Pharaoh Menkaure.
sphinx: The Great Sphinx of Giza, a statue with a lion body and a pharaoh head, guarding the pyramids.
